alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 9:25PM EDT until May 03 at 12:48AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Androscoggin and Sagadahoc Counties. Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Oxford and Carroll Counties. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Franklin, Androscoggin and Oxford Counties. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Franklin and Somerset Counties. Sandy River At Mercer affecting Franklin and Somerset Counties. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Maine... Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. For the Saco River...including Conway...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Androscoggin River...including Gorham, Rumford, Auburn... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Sandy River...including Mercer...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Warner River...including Davisville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Androscoggin River near Auburn. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Route 136 at Stackpole Road in Durham begins to flood. At 14.8 feet, Route 136 at Stackpole Road in Durham floods to a depth of 1 foot. North River Road in Auburn floods. Water rises up to the retaining wall behind Roak Block on Main Street in Auburn. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EDT Monday was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
